description.other_details:
SOGC Fetal health Surveillance: antepartum and intrapartum Consensus Guideline: http://www.sogc.org/guidelines/documents/gui197CPG0709r.pdf
Intrapartum care: management and delivery of care to women in labour: http://www.nice.org.uk/nicemedia/live/11837/36275/36275.pdf

details.purpose: To record details about the fetal heart beat during periods of fetal monitoring to assist in the assessment of fetal well-being.
details.use:
Use to record the details about the fetal heart beat during periods of monitoring, usually in late pregnancy or during labor.
Use to capture findings from electronic monitoring, including cardiotocography.
Use is restricted to recording details about the heart beat of a fetus.
details.misuse:
Not to be used to record simple, intermittent measurements of fetal heart rate - use the parent archetype OBSERVATION.fetal_heart instead.
Not to be used for recording the heart rate of infants, children or adults.

items.items: Heart rate accelerations are present and occurring spontaneously.
Fetal heart accelerations are detected as a result of fetal scap stimulation.
Fetal heart rate accelerations are not detected with fetal scalp stimulation.
Frequency of early accelerations observed during the monitoring interval.
Occasional decelerations detected but occur in association with less than 50% of uterine contractions..
Decelerations detected in association with over 50% of uterine contractions.
Frequency of uncomplicated variable decelerations observed during the monitoring interval.
Frequency of complicated variable decelerations observed during the monitoring interval.
Variability in the fetal heart rate observed during the monitoring interval.
Frequency of late decelerations observed during the monitoring interval.
Duration of a single, prolonged deceleration observed during the monitoring interval.
Can be recorded multiple times during the period of observation - one duration recorded for each discrete deceleration.
Inclusion of any multimedia file to support the recording of findings during fetal heart monitoring.
For example, printed recording of the CTG.
Overall conclusion regarding findings during the monitoring interval.
Monitoring during this interval reveals a normal Fetal Heart Rate pattern.
Monitoring during this interval reveals an atypical or suspicious pattern.
Monitoring during this interval reveals an abnormal or pathological pattern.
Monitoring interval used as the basis for later comparisons eg not in labor or in early labor.
Description of incidental maternal factors, not recorded elsewhere, that may cause difficulties in monitoring or effect the quality of the tracing.
For example, posterior position or active fetal movement.
Was the mother in active labor during the monitoring interval?
Category of variability observed during the monitoring interval.
Description of labor during the monitoring interval.
Heart rate variability is greater than undetectable, but less than or equal to 5 beats per minute.
Heart rate variability is between 6-25 beats per minute.
Heart rate variability is greater than 25 beats per minute.
Description of the pattern of variability observed during the monitoring interval.
For example, identifying a sinusoidal pattern.
Presence of accelerations observed during the monitoring interval.
Characteristics about the fetal heart rate.
Monitoring of the characteristics of the fetal heart rate , usually over intervals of time.
The fetal heart beat is detected.
Implied as true if fetal heart rate > 0.
The measured rate of the fetal heart during the monitoring interval.
The measured rate of the fetal heart during the monitoring interval.
Additional narrative about the fetal heart monitoring not captured in other fields.
Additional narrative about the fetal heart monitoring not captured in other fields.
Concise and clinically contextualised narrative interpretation of the fetal heart rate.
The position of the mother during the monitoring interval.
The position of the mother during the monitoring interval.
Mother standing at the time of fetal heart rate measurement.
Mother sitting at the time of fetail heart rate measurement.
Mother reclining at the time of fetal heart rate measurement.
Lying flat at the time of fetal heart rate measurement.
Mother lying flat with some lateral tilt towards the left.
Description of incidental maternal factors, not recorded elsewhere, that may cause difficulties in monitoring or effect the quality of the tracing.
For example, maternal fever, obesity or exertion.
Description of incidental maternal factors, not recorded elsewhere, that may cause difficulties in monitoring or effect the quality of the tracing.
Details about the device used to auscultate the fetal heart rate. For example, details about the CTG machine.
